intro: Pedicularis tamurensis, commonly known as the Japanese lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Japan. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that range in color from red to purple. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats and is adapted to cool, moist environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
